GitTagTask

Extends \GitBaseTask

Wrapper around git-tag

Use \Project#createTask to register a new Task.

author

Evan Kaufman evan@digitalflophouse.com
author

Victor Farazdagi simple.square@gmail.com
version

$Id: d01c0f1426d0075ae04ff7c156452d08909e966a $
package

phing.tasks.ext.git
see
since 2.4.5

This is abstract here, but may not be overloaded by subclasses.

Logs a message with the given priority.

log(string $msg, integer $level = \Project::MSG_INFO) : void
inherited

Arguments

$msg

string

The message to be logged.

$level

integer

The message's priority at this message should have

Called by the project to let the task do it's work. This method may be called more than once, if the task is invoked more than once. For example, if target1 and target2 both depend on target3, then running <em>phing target1 target2</em> will run all tasks in target3 twice.

main()
inherited abstract

Should throw a BuildException if someting goes wrong with the build

This is abstract here. Must be overloaded by real tasks.

Configure this task if it hasn't been done already.

maybeConfigure()
inherited

perform()
inherited
throws

Properties

Make unsigned, annotated tag object. See -a of git-tag

annotate : boolean
var

Type(s)

boolean

Make GPG-signed tag. See -s of git-tag

sign : boolean
var

Type(s)

boolean

Make GPG-signed tag, using given key. See -u of git-tag

keySign : string
var

Type(s)

string

Replace existing tag with given name. See -f of git-tag

replace : boolean
var

Type(s)

boolean

Delete existing tags with given names. See -d of git-tag

delete : boolean
var

Type(s)

boolean

Verify gpg signature of given tag names. See -v of git-tag

verify : boolean
var

Type(s)

boolean

List tags with names matching given pattern. See -l of git-tag

list : boolean
var

Type(s)

boolean

<num> specifies how many lines from the annotation, if any, are printed when using -l. See -n of git-tag

num : integer
var

Type(s)

integer

Only list tags containing specified commit. See --contains of git-tag

contains : string
var

Type(s)

string

Use given tag message. See -m of git-tag

message : string
var

Type(s)

string

Take tag message from given file. See -F of git-tag

file : string
var

Type(s)

string

<tagname> argument to git-tag

name : string
var

string
